derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French plaintif 'plaintive' (used as a noun). The -f ending has come down through Law French; the word was originally the same as plaintive

encyclopedia.content: A plaintiff (Π in legal shorthand), also known as a claimant or complainant, is the party who initiates a lawsuit (also known as an action) before a court. By doing so, the plaintiff seeks a legal remedy, and if successful, the court will issue judgment in favor of the plaintiff and make the appropriate court order (eg. an order for damages). In some jurisdictions the commencement of a lawsuit is

entry.def: A plaintiff is a person who brings a legal case against someone in a court of law.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who brings an action in a court of law
